The color, the firmness, the fabric - we love it.

Their drool marks wipe right off easily and it’s a great couch for pets.

Review text: So hands down I love my sofa. 5/5 stars, They are super versatile, great storage, and pretty comfty., Reason why I’m giving it 4/5 stars., Instructions are confusing. You read and it says box a has this and box b has this and combine a and b to make C, WHEN all you have is box b., What it doesn’t say is everything is in box b., Ok cool, so box b has 5 legs (yes you will use all 5) and 1 arm cushion. NOTE: a 3 seater sofa uses 5 arms ( one on each side and 3 for the back) again instructions didn’t say that. (Would have been nice to known) and if you have 8 pieces, you get 8 separate boxes., For screws they use a Phillips screw and give you a flat head. (Very minor), Lastly hardware, they give you a ton of clips for the cushions/back support, but really wished they gave more hardware for combining the pieces together. I used all the joints but have like 8 extra arm brackets. (Totally wish I had like 2-3 more of the combining brackets), Another note on assembly, if your OCD with having the storage open the same, I highly recommend you build all of the sofa pieces first then the arms. Will save you time., On company’s improvement: can you add some extra designs on instructions? The Amazon pics have some solid layouts and wish the instructions had them listed or even had other forms since it’s super versatile., Lastly, do you sell individual modules since I would love to get one more to expand on the 8 piece module to make it one side a longer automan? Or for others having a option to buy extra arms to complete a live seat.

Review text: **the black line on the wall is for reference of how much shorter this couch is than my previous. When sitting straight up the backrest hits just under your breast with at least half your back directly on the wall**, I was so excited for this couch and was devastated when I opened it and realized it was made for tiny people. This couch ended up being 4 inches shorter than advertised. Customer service is an absolute joke and will not get back to you. Not even 2 months in to owning and a beam is already splintering on one of the chaise! We are not big people and are very gentle on the furniture. I didn’t have high hopes opening as the structure itself is not built with much support to begin with. This couch is also extremely uncomfortable with hard and very cheap feeling material. The cushions are maybe 4 inches thick and that is being generous. In my opinion, Save your money. This couch is the worst purchase of my life. On god.

Its cute and fairly  comfortable and my mother loves it.

I am 54 and its long enough for me to sleep on with room to spare."

I was very doubtful because of the brand.

But took a faith of Amazon return policy and ordered it.

I must say it is very comfortable and looks very stylish.

It’s been only couple of weeks so can’t comment on build quality but overall very happy with it so far.

Leather looks and feels very rich!

I got so many compliments from my friends and family.

Review text: The sofa is perfect for what we needed it for which was just a seldom used couch in front of a tv in our basement. The size works for us. The seating is rather firm which some people may not like. It’s definitely not a sink down in the seat type couch but the firmness is fine with us. The fabric is soft and with the back cushions removed, it’s wide enough for someone to sleep on if needed. The delivery went smoothly and the only assembly is to screw on the legs! Overall, IN LOVE with this sofa!!!! So comfy, so well built, so beautiful. Would def buy again.

Review text: Good quality and not difficult to build, if you make some adjustments I listed below. I built it myself in under an hour. Keep in mind there is not a lot of padding, so this is more for looks. The comfort level was fine for me., 1. Before installing anything, unscrew the golden metal bars, remove the safety wrap, then re-screw them back on. It’s so much easier than trying to remove at the end., Also, keep in mind that with or without the safety wrap, those metal pieces can scratch your flooring and you if you’re not careful! After install, the corners are covered so it’s no longer an issue, 2. When installing the 2 pieces with legs, put them up against a wall and ensure the metal pieces line up before you start screwing the legs in. It will be a little harder to get the legs in the designated holes, but the sofa will be lined up properly and avoids unevenness between the 2 metal plates, 3. Install the 2 armrests at the very end. It gets in the way if you try yo do it prior. (This is only helpful if you’re using the wall method I said. Otherwise instal first and use for balance), 4. If the armrests are creating a gap or something is damaged with shipping, message them. Their customer service is phenomenal and quick to respond!, I really love the look of the sofa! I got the matching chair as well and it looks amazing in my living room!

, It’s not that comfortable, but it looks for the most part like the photos.

, The back cushions do not have cut outs for the round pillows like the photos, The back cushions puffed up pretty well.

, It is about an inch and a half shorter than the description, It is very firm and the back is pretty low.

, The fabric is pretty plasticky, but seems like it will hold up really well.

Review text: The futon arrived without the weird little pillow things, but that was ok. Those weird little pillow things seem like they’d be a pain to keep track of and my cat would probably destroy them anyway., I bought this for a couple of reasons. I have a large living room that has 2 full size couches and a love seat. My dog claimed one couch years ago. At the end of the old boys life, he had accidents frequently. The couch he claimed did not go unscathed. When the dog passed, the couch had to go. So I needed a new one. My daughter comes to town every couple of months for appointments with her specialist. Her and her boyfriend like to sack out in the living room. So I figured a couch the folded down into bed would be the best choice., Pros:, Easily assembled, Super simple to convert into a bed, Low profile, which is awesome in a house of short people, Easily cleaned, spills wipe right off, Potential cons:, Very firm, Smaller than a twin, making sheets fit weird, Definitely need a sheet on it to sleep, otherwise exposed body parts stick to the pleather, I solved the cons with a simple inexpensive fitted memory foam mattress topper. I keep it on there at all times and I keep the sheet on it at all times. I found a sheet set that matches my other furniture, so the sheet helps it blend in, the topper makes the couch more comfy to sit (and sleep) on, and you don’t stick to it when wearing shorts., All in all, it’s a great and inexpensive piece of furniture. Especially if you have young children or pets. Because, let’s face it, if you have kids and/or pets, your furniture is going to die a horrible death anyway. This has a chance to potentially last years with kids and pets.

Review text:
This sofa bed was delivered with a Serta label both on the outside of the box it was shipped in.

And, a large Serta label attached to the fabric shell.

I believe I was purposely MIs led into thinking I had a good quality piece of furniture.

The sofa bed is very hard and firm.

That first night I decided to sleep on it was a mistake.

Review text: I bought this futon for the weird and crazy room we have in the extra bedroom so I had somewhere to sleep when I was on night shift and the family is doing their chaotic stuff during the daytime. Whew. Well anyway, it’s ALRIGHT to sleep on from to time. I’m about 69 inches tall and pretty much fit on here if I lay my head near the end. There are basically two sides, the “seat” cushion and the “back” cushion. There’s a bit of frame in the middle that doesn’t have all that much cushion. But pick a “side” and it’s decently comfortable. Look, I don’t think ANY futon is ever going to really compare to a bed. You’re in the market for a futon because you need a compromise of some sort, right? At this price point, I’m really happy with it. It’s a couch that turns the space into something a couple people can hang out in and serves a sleepable surface when you need it to.

Review text: Rather good quality for the price and a great couch for a small apartment. It’s on the firmer side, but not rock hard, just the right amount - in the picture i was pressing on it with force. You won’t sink into it, but it’s pretty comfortable and sleeping on it is fine too. A 6 foot person will have trouble sleeping on it, but you can remove the armrests and worst case their legs will slightly hang over the edge. The pull-out mechanism works very smoothly and it’s incredibly easy to make it into a bed or make more space to stretch out while watching a movie. The color in the picture is Beige. The width of the chaise section is  52”, of the rest of the couch is 28.5”, the size of the sleeping area is 48.5” x 71”. After a few months i’m sure we’ll start seeing signs of wear and where the favorite spots are, but it seems of pretty good quality for the price and we expect it to last at least 2+ years. It assembled well and easy (note, the holes for most legs are not pre-drilled, so you’ll either need to use some force with a screwdriver or use an impact driver to screw them in. Second note, make sure you’ve put each armrest on the right side and fit it correctly. They will fit, you just need to get it right! The left one, where the chaise is, you just fit in from the top while not touching the couch, while the other one you have to do the opposite, the armrest is kind of standing freely and you fit the couch into it. The way to see that you’re doing it right is that the “bent” parts of the connectors on the couch and the armrest must fit each other.)

Review text:
I am 260 pounds and 5' 10".

This couch can definitely handle my weight.

Very well built.

Solid construction.

Could be more comfortable however.

The seating is very narrow and short depth so be prepared to sit up straight.

The chaise lounge fixes that problem though.

As does the pull out bed section.

Once you lay on the longer sections of the couch it also helps.

Although if you are tall your feet will still hang off the edge unless you lay down length wise.

Review text:
If youre looking for a super soft and squishy sofa, this is not it.

I wanted something firm to sleep on, which the seat part provides.

The back cushions are soft and comfortable, so for me this is a perfect combination.

The chaise top lifts easily for storing bedding or whatever else you may want to use it for.

I had been looking at Ikea sofas for some time, but there is no local Ikea and delivery is extremely expensive.

Review text: Rather good quality for the price and a great couch for a small apartment. It’s on the firmer side, but not rock hard, just the right amount - in the picture i was pressing on it with force. You won’t sink into it, but it’s pretty comfortable and sleeping on it is fine too. A 6 foot person will have trouble sleeping on it, but you can remove the armrests and worst case their legs will slightly hang over the edge. The pull-out mechanism works very smoothly and it’s incredibly easy to make it into a bed or make more space to stretch out while watching a movie. The color in the picture is Beige. The width of the chaise section is  52”, of the rest of the couch is 28.5”, the size of the sleeping area is 48.5” x 71”. After a few months i’m sure we’ll start seeing signs of wear and where the favorite spots are, but it seems of pretty good quality for the price and we expect it to last at least 2+ years. It assembled well and easy (note, the holes for most legs are not pre-drilled, so you’ll either need to use some force with a screwdriver or use an impact driver to screw them in. Second note, make sure you’ve put each armrest on the right side and fit it correctly. They will fit, you just need to get it right! The left one, where the chaise is, you just fit in from the top while not touching the couch, while the other one you have to do the opposite, the armrest is kind of standing freely and you fit the couch into it. Review text:
I purchased this sofa for my daughter.

The price was good and I have two in my home that are similar, or so I thought.

The sofa arrived in a box and required you to assemble it.

The back clips on without any screws or latches to hold it in place.

The material is rough and isn’t velvet or faux velvet.

I’m not sure what it is really.

Lastly, NONE of the pieces really fit together.

So it feels wobbly and disproportionate.

My worry at this point is returning the sofa.

Review text: I recently purchased the Vesgantti  Loveseat Sofa in Green Velvet, and I am absolutely in love with it!,  The sofa is beautifully made, with a sleek and modern design that perfectly complements my living room décor. The velvet fabric is soft and luxurious, and the tufted back adds a touch of sophistication., The sofa is also very comfortable to sit on., The seat and cushions are filled with high-density sponge, which provides excellent support and pressure relief. I can easily spend hours sitting on this sofa without feeling any discomfort.  Another great thing about this sofa is that it is very easy to assemble. All I had to do was screw on the legs, and it was ready to go in less than 10 minutes.  Overall, I am extremely happy with the Sofa. It is a stylish, comfortable, and well-made piece of furniture that is perfect for any home. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a new loveseat.  Here are some of the pros and cons of the Loveseat Sofa:,  Pros:  Stylish and modern design Soft and luxurious velvet fabric Comfortable to sit on Easy to assemble Cons:The velvet fabric can be difficult to keep clean Overall, I believe that the pros of the  Sofa outweigh the cons. It is a great value for the price, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable and stylish loveseat.

I guess this is what $300 buys you."

Review text: We have 2 little ones and we love to have movie/snuggle nights! We wanted something that is like a futon but didn’t want our living room looking like a 19 year old dorm room., We’ve had it about 2 weeks so far but it’s amazing. It’s sturdy. And it’s so comfy to lay on. Wasn’t as deep as we would prefer but it’s at least a foot longer than we anticipated! We can easily fit 5 adults on this thing, sitting. And can cram our family of 4 and our 100 lb lab on it laying down for movie nights. And be comfortable., I was able to move it inside, multiple boxes, and put it all together myself in under an hour., The deep green is just beautiful and matches our aesthetic so nicely., If you’re debating, just do it. We love this thing!!

Review text:
It looks nice.

It’s sturdy and comfortable.

Three stars because the wood was chipped when I got it.

Also, the instructions were a little unclear, it took me about an hour or two to put it together.

TIP*

** do NOT tighten anything fully until all bolts are put in place.

Tighten them just enough so they stay in place.

Once everything is in place, then tighten the bolts.

This would have saved me a lot of frustration.

Review text:
It’s not heavy duty wood, so I only tightened the screws until I felt some resistance.

Otherwise I feel like the wood could possibly crack.

I had no issues of there not being predrilled holes.

It comes with some brown caps to hide the screws once you finish.

I completely disregarded them as they are difficult to fit them in.

Two people sat in it and it didn’t seem to wobble or make noise.

Hopefully it’ll stand the test of time.

Review text: Looks pretty good and not super cheap. It fits our space well. It’s a little less deep than I expected but i guess that’s on me, but not so shallow that it’s uncomfortable to sit on. Fairly firm but not too much, i happen to like firmer seating., It was a real bitch to assemble even tho in theory it looked simple. I did it by myself, and hey I got it done, but would’ve been much easier having someone else hold up the heavier end while you’re hoisting up the other end. Additionally one side of the lower cushion did not have a predrilled, threaded hole so that was a real challenge to figure out. Had to predrill a hole myself through the fabric, then screw the bolt in from the frame side of the lower cushion, unscrew it, then rescrew it on the correct side. Additionally the hardware isn’t “missing” a screw per se but the instructions suggest you should have 7 of the longer screws but they give you 6 of the longer ones and 5 of the shorter screws so you think hey I’m missing a longer screw is this going to be secure enough with a shorter screw? And it took some trial and error to realize that you should use the shorter screw for the lower frame. You’ll understand what I mean when you build it lol, Anyway I got it built in about 40 minutes all things considered, and it feels secure and comfortable and overall am very happy with this purchase

Had to predrill a hole myself through the fabric, then screw the bolt in from the frame side of the lower cushion, unscrew it, then rescrew it on the correct side. Additionally the hardware isn’t “missing” a screw per se but the instructions suggest you should have 7 of the longer screws but they give you 6 of the longer ones and 5 of the shorter screws so you think hey I’m missing a longer screw is this going to be secure enough with a shorter screw? And it took some trial and error to realize that you should use the shorter screw for the lower frame. You’ll understand what I mean when you build it lol, Anyway I got it built in about 40 minutes all things considered, and it feels secure and comfortable and overall am very happy with this purchase

I got this just before the pandemic.

I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 3 simply because of the old "you get what you pay for" story.

It certainly looks nice and it functions just fine, but because my job requires me to sit on a computer for most of the day the cushion wore out pretty quickly.

I'll have to see if there's a way I can put in some sort of supports or something, but the size is exactly what I needed and the overall design is very nice for being such a low cost sofa/loveseat.

Quite uncomfortable, as you have what seems to be a few bars sticking out into your back and pressure on your hips and head., Solution:, Sleeping with your head towards the section you pull out was a lot more comfortable. I also padded it with a few blankets, both while in the sleeper position and seating. The last picture shows how I set up and sleep in the bed. I plan to get a small foam topper as well for added comfort., Overall, good purchase. Of the options available, I think it was a good deal.

Review text:
This couch is good for my very small 1 bdrm.

There’s a lot of Velcro during assembly and it took ~<1 hour w/ 2 ppl.

I have had this couch for 2 months & am still happy with my purchase.

The material is soft & is able to look clean even w a tuxedo cat who sheds and loves to claw at the sides of the couch (close up on material included in photos).

I have noticed a few strings coming out from the clawing but nothing a little snip can’t fix.

Overall holding up well.

Review text:
I was a little hesitant to purchase this sofa just because you never know what quality you’ll get when you shop online.

Overall, I was pleasantly surprised!

The fabric is nice and soft, the back cushions are perfectly plump, and it is very lightweight.

I will say, I do wish the bottom cushions were a bit thicker and because of that, the couch is a little more firm than I’d like.

A lot of the reviews say that you need two people to assemble, but I did it alone in about 30-45 minutes.

Review text: Reason I gave two stars instead of one is because fedex just dropped it outside of my grandma’s apartment and she had to pay someone to bring it up to the third floor and the seller was kindly enough to return the shipping cost even though it still cost me more., Now to the couch. Love the feel and the fabric but the cushion self has no support. I left it out for 3 days with out sitting on it so it has time to expand but it still feels like I’m sitting on wood. I don’t know is it because mine are defected or is it because these cushions just don’t have any stiffness to them. I’ve read the reviews and they said it was on the harder side but mine was not the case. Now the back cushion is even worst. It looks fluffy but when sitting back on it, you fall right through it meaning you can feel everything behind it especially the back that goes across the back. It’s like it is filled with feathers., Ps this is a Christmas gift for my grandmother and she hates it but doesn’t want to deal with the hassle of getting a new one. So she doesn’t even want to use it. It’s hard getting on and off the couch., Do not recommend

Review text: My partner and I originally had a small love seat that was bought 3 years ago before we got together so it was always too small for the both of us. We made plans of getting this exact couch for so long with so much hope for it and it certainly did not fail. The pull out aspect of the couch is absolutely amazing and perfect for us especially when we want to cuddle and do movie nights, only negative thing about it, is how easy it detaches from the couch if you don’t pull it out correctly but it is easy to put back in. I love the part that lifts up because I finally have a place to store all of my blankets and the baby’s extra blankets as well. It was an easy assembly for my partner and I. I was very iffy about the other reviews that would speak about the firmness of the couch, and when it did come in and was put together, it definitely was firm but after a few days of using it, it’s definitely less firm and more comfy. The cushions attach and detach via velcro which I think is awesome since my last couch the cushions were always messed up and on the floor since they didnt attach. All in all, this couch is perfect and definitely worth the money spent on it.

Review text: I am so impressed with this purchase! This was incredibly easy to assemble and took about 90 minutes (mostly unpacking it out of the boxes and vacuum sealed plastic). The upholstery is velvety soft, and the cushions are nicely padded. It appears to be easy to clean. It’s a lot bigger than I was expecting, which makes laying horizontal a lot easier. The arm rests, aka “side pillows”, ARE removable. They are more pillow than anything. I was hoping so when purchasing, but couldn’t really figure out beforehand from the pictures (maybe I should start reading item descriptions idk). Overall, great couch for the price.

Review text: This couch is not what I expected. It came in three separate boxes on three separate days., It was very easy to put together on my own. It took me about one hour and a half. The pillows do not stay attached to the back of the couch and the armrest has no structure so you’re not able to really rest your arm. It is not something you would want in your main living room.  I don’t have the patience or a large enough car,  to box all of this up and lug it to a UPS store for a return… I can’t stand it. I’m getting ready to sell it.

Review text: One of the 12 legs arrived broken inside of the box. The legs are made of plastic so don’t expect them to hold up for very long. Reached out to CS and they won’t send out a replacement part, and I was told by CS that my only option is to return the couch to Amazon in the three boxes it originally arrived in just to have another whole couch shipped out. Guess who won’t be getting assistance on this matter since the couch is already assembled and in use?, Don’t let this be you. Think twice before you decide to go for this couch. The design is nice, the couch is spacious, all cushion covers are removable for washing, and the comfort level is medium firm. But the cons are that the back cushions constantly fall forward as they don’t have anything to grip onto (an easy fix for this is adhesive Velcro straps but you’ll have to make that additional, yet small investment), and you also run the risk of having some type of unseen damage to any part of the couch before unboxing. In this case, there were no punctures/holes/tears/damage to the boxes exterior. An additional investment will have to be made for a full new set of 12 legs as well, since I can’t get an identical replacement for the original leg nor will anything that’s available for purchase on Amazon be a match.,  And if you decide to go with the cream-colored couch and you have little ones running around or pets, definitely invest in a sofa cover. You won’t find a cover set on Amazon that will match the exact shape of this couch (or anything even close to it), so you will have to order each individual cover part separately for this U shaped sectional. I ended up purchasing an XL chase cover for the base of the middle seating section (as it’s the only cover that can accommodate its dimensions), 4 more XL chase covers for the two chaise bases and their respective seat cushions, 2 standard seat covers for the middle seats, and 4 back cushion covers. When you add up the total cost to each of these, it will cost more than double if not triple than most couch cover sets on Amazon! Unfortunately it’s ANOTHER investment that needs to be made, but you won’t have to constantly go back to spot treat the original fabric or washing the original cushion covers often, and with a couch cover you’re protecting your overall investment., Your best bet is to either go with the gray color option (if it’s in stock), or just throw in the additional $100-$300 and simply go with a pricier, but better off couch. With as much money as I’ve ended up putting into this couch, I would’ve been far better off going with a different sofa., Keep all of these factors in mind before you buy. I hope this helps someone that’s considering purchasing this sectional. I hope you make the right investment for you, your needs, and your lifestyle.

I appreciate the sturdy construction, and the click-clack mechanism for adjusting between sofa and bed modes is smooth and reliable., "In summary, if youre in need of a space saving fruniture solution without compromising on comfort, this futon sofa bed is an excellent choice. Review text: "Weve just moved into our new home and have had frequent guests stay over. We initially started off with an air mattress and thought this would be a better purchase for our company. it arrived fairly quick and it was pretty easy to unbox. Assembly was also fairly quick, even if some of the hole didnt perfectly match up to screw it all together. When we first sat on it, we realized it was VERY LOW to the ground, which is fine for me since I am quite short (53) but my husband is 6 and has to hoist himself off the couch when he gets up. The couch is quite firm as well, just to sit on, but laying is almost impossible. Its so stiff with no cushion at all. Our guests say they prefer the air mattress, and I dont disagree. It is easy to wipe down, but the cup holder feature in the middle never stay up and if two people sit on the couch it squishes each person almost in half. All in all, its fine for the price but we wont be using it for long."

I appreciate the sturdy construction, and the click-clack mechanism for adjusting between sofa and bed modes is smooth and reliable., "In summary, if youre in need of a space saving fruniture solution without compromising on comfort, this futon sofa bed is an excellent choice. Review text: My daughter has a small nook under her bookshelf and we thought this couch would be a perfect fit to utilize the space. When I initially measured I was unsure how a couch this small was going to look, but it arrived yesterday and it is super cute. It literally looks like a large couch that was hit with a shrink ray lol. I’m not expecting this thing to last forever but the quality is decent, the cushions are firm and the fabric seems like it will hold up nicely. We ordered black and it’s definitely not a true black…more of a dark gray/charcoal. My daughter is 14 and 4’11….don’t let the stock pictures fool you…a grown woman sitting on this couch will not look normal lol…but for a small space it’s perfect! And for the price you really can’t beat it! It was also very easy to assemble, although it was heavier than I expected (which I’m fine with). All in all, I’m happy with this purchase!

I love this!

It's more of a kids room size piece, lower to the ground.

I probably wouldn't want to watch a whole movie that way as the back sections goes up to about my shoudler blades, not uncomfortable, just not supportive of the shoulders.

It's cute!

It comes with two little pillows!

Everything seems pretty well built and quality, I'm really happy with it.

Review text: My daughter has a small nook under her bookshelf and we thought this couch would be a perfect fit to utilize the space. When I initially measured I was unsure how a couch this small was going to look, but it arrived yesterday and it is super cute. It literally looks like a large couch that was hit with a shrink ray lol. I’m not expecting this thing to last forever but the quality is decent, the cushions are firm and the fabric seems like it will hold up nicely. We ordered black and it’s definitely not a true black…more of a dark gray/charcoal. My daughter is 14 and 4’11….don’t let the stock pictures fool you…a grown woman sitting on this couch will not look normal lol…but for a small space it’s perfect! And for the price you really can’t beat it! It was also very easy to assemble, although it was heavier than I expected (which I’m fine with). All in all, I’m happy with this purchase!

The beige fabric also looks and feels very cheap and it gets stained easily. Also the rough (hook) side of the Velcro that keeps the removable armrests in place are sewn to the bed, instead of the armrests, which make sleeping on the bed even more uncomfortable. And it is too short for even a young adult to sleep on it. So if you are looking for a sofa-bed avoid this low-quality product at all cost and look elsewhere.

Review text: "Good back support, with it being adjustable and all. Dont try to sleep on it unless you have a good bale of hay for cushioning. Tried it out as a simple couch in my game room...worked for about two weeks, then the springs collapsed, broke , but only where I sit. Im definitely not a heavy guy. My thin friends are fatter than I am, and their side of the couch held up.",  The "armrests" have zippers on them, so you can shove some old shirts or towels in them. Otherwise, they serve no purpose.,  On the plus side: I met my wife by ordering this futon. Funny story. The "under carriage" is where you'll find the legs and parts to assemble it...along with (depending on where it's shipped from) an Eastern European woman named Nadja. In hindsight, I guess it was for the best that it it only collapsed in one spot. She looked and smelled like she was in there for a pretty lengthy boat ride. Such a sweetheart...and the voice of an angel.,  The cup holders/dual ashtrays are okay, I guess. Would not recommend.

Review text: Ok, I was scared to order a couch with hardly any reviews off of Amazon, but this is a really great couch (not just great for the price but actually great!)! I’ve been waiting for a look-alike from West Elm (the Paidge) to be delivered for months and got so fed up with not having a couch that I decided to just get a cheaper one off Amazon for a few months until my West Elm one comes with the plan to pass this one off to someone else. But I’m so pleased with this one that I may actually end up keeping this for myself and passing on the West Elm one on to someone else! I got this in the blue velvet which is beautiful and very soft (nicer than I thought, although the fabric is incredibly slippery!). The scooped arms are gorgeous. The four main legs which I thought would be wood are actually hollow plastic which I’m not so happy about (not that you can tell from looking at them when assembled), but with the two actually-wood support legs in the back this seems sturdy. There is no creaking or anything. I was worried that the main cushions seemed too firm to me when I was putting this together (the back ones are much softer) but I’m about a week in and finding this sofa very comfortable. This did come with two screws that I think were supposed to be used to secure the arms to the seat (in addition to interlocking brackets) that I could not for the life of me figure out what to do with—seemed like it was missing pre-drilled holes—so I left them off, but things still seem study so far. If anyone’s been eyeing this couch but is reluctant to take the plunge with no reviews, I can highly recommend this!

Review text: Ok, I was scared to order a couch with hardly any reviews off of Amazon, but this is a really great couch (not just great for the price but actually great!)! I’ve been waiting for a look-alike from West Elm (the Paidge) to be delivered for months and got so fed up with not having a couch that I decided to just get a cheaper one off Amazon for a few months until my West Elm one comes with the plan to pass this one off to someone else. But I’m so pleased with this one that I may actually end up keeping this for myself and passing on the West Elm one on to someone else! I got this in the blue velvet which is beautiful and very soft (nicer than I thought, although the fabric is incredibly slippery!). The scooped arms are gorgeous. The four main legs which I thought would be wood are actually hollow plastic which I’m not so happy about (not that you can tell from looking at them when assembled), but with the two actually-wood support legs in the back this seems sturdy. There is no creaking or anything. I was worried that the main cushions seemed too firm to me when I was putting this together (the back ones are much softer) but I’m about a week in and finding this sofa very comfortable. This did come with two screws that I think were supposed to be used to secure the arms to the seat (in addition to interlocking brackets) that I could not for the life of me figure out what to do with—seemed like it was missing pre-drilled holes—so I left them off, but things still seem study so far. If anyone’s been eyeing this couch but is reluctant to take the plunge with no reviews, I can highly recommend this!

Review text:
This couch is great.

The color, the firmness, the fabric - we love it.

It’s so great to be able to move the pieces of the couch around for different occasions.

We keep it like this the most with blankets, just as extra precaution to keep it nice, because I have two German shepherds and one is a 5 month old puppy.

However the couch holds up to the puppy well!

Review text: "This couch was extremely easy to put together and while the packages are quite big its essentially 1 package is 1 bottom and 1 back piece in a box, so that makes sense. This is not a tall-backed couch and with the pillows on the couch the seats are a few inches smaller than I was hoping for, however moving the pillow solves this for me when I want to sit all the way back. Its not the most comfortable couch to lounge/nap on however because of the construction its got the harder-spots between each seat. That was expected, but so anyone else looking at this knows for sure, yeah that is a thing. The cushions are decent foam and while like all foam it will start to deform if you sit on the edges (between seats or on the ends) its got a good level of bounce back ability. The absolute best part of this couch is just being able to rearrange it to whatever seating arrangement you need for your room. Its not so heavy you cant move the pieces yourself, and the connectors are extremely easy to take in and out to change it up."

Review text: So hands down I love my sofa. 5/5 stars, They are super versatile, great storage, and pretty comfty., Reason why I’m giving it 4/5 stars., Instructions are confusing. You read and it says box a has this and box b has this and combine a and b to make C, WHEN all you have is box b., What it doesn’t say is everything is in box b., Ok cool, so box b has 5 legs (yes you will use all 5) and 1 arm cushion. NOTE: a 3 seater sofa uses 5 arms ( one on each side and 3 for the back) again instructions didn’t say that. (Would have been nice to known) and if you have 8 pieces, you get 8 separate boxes., For screws they use a Phillips screw and give you a flat head. (Very minor), Lastly hardware, they give you a ton of clips for the cushions/back support, but really wished they gave more hardware for combining the pieces together. I used all the joints but have like 8 extra arm brackets. (Totally wish I had like 2-3 more of the combining brackets), Another note on assembly, if your OCD with having the storage open the same, I highly recommend you build all of the sofa pieces first then the arms. Will save you time., On company’s improvement: can you add some extra designs on instructions? The Amazon pics have some solid layouts and wish the instructions had them listed or even had other forms since it’s super versatile., Lastly, do you sell individual modules since I would love to get one more to expand on the 8 piece module to make it one side a longer automan? Or for others having a option to buy extra arms to complete a live seat.

It is average quality for the price and I was actually surprised by its comfort once the cushions had a chance to expand. It is packed very tight for Shipping, so after you put it together (several bolts supplied with slightly sketchy instructions but not hard) it will take a couple days to let the cushions settle to form and material unwrinkle. It is a very small couch but exactly the size and space I was looking to fill

Review text:
The description and product reviews are a bit misleading.

This sofa would be perfect for a child or tween's bedroom or play room.

I absolutely do not recommend purchasing it as an adult, even if you have a small apartment or small living room.

The cushions are firm and uncomfortable.

Our standard size coffee table is taller than the seating.

The seat is also too narrow for an adult.

I'm 5'4" and my legs hang off the end of the chaise.

1/10 stars.

I absolutely LOVE this couch!

The size was perfect for the space.

I was afraid it would be too small or uncomfortable, but it’s neither.

It seats two people upright comfortably, the fabric feels soft, and the low back makes for a comfortable arm rest when conversing.

It was super easy to assemble.

Kudos to the designer!

Did I mention it’s also super cute?!

The back is literally about to break when my 13 yr old son who is average build and height is leaning on the back, in regular sitting position.

It looks like whatever mechanism holds the back up into the couch position is about to give way and in about a weeks time of regular use we will have nothing more than a small twin sized bed with an uncomfortable mattress.

Do not recommend purchase for anyone over the age of 10.

Review text:
It’s pretty small since it’s only about 4 inches off the ground but you get what you pay for, the couch is really comfortable can fit 2 people with the cup holders down and 3 with them lifted, kinda stiff to lay on but not unbearable and the 2 arm rests/pillows it comes with are hard if you use them as pillows so I just cut up the foam inside it into peace’s to make it more comfortable and it worked.

Given the price it’s a pretty decent couch and the cup holders are an added bonus.

Review text: $200 is really not much to pay for a couch including shipping. I only purchased this as a "nice to have" piece in my short-term room, and would definitely get something nicer if I were buying for comfort or longevity., It ticks many boxes for me: cheap, looks good, not overly uncomfortable, not overly fragile, transforms into a futon (although it would probably be slightly worse than my carpeted floor), and transports in two halves for ease of transport and assembly. The last bit is important to me as I needed to haul it up several flights of stairs., There are 6 legs, each needing 4 screws, so this couch should have come with 24 screws. It came with 21. I spread out the missing screws over 3 of the corner legs, on the side that I reasoned would experience the least pulling force. The couch came out steady enough, but those missing screws will forever be in the back of my mind., Even with all the screws, the way the two sofa halves are connected is simply by screwing in the legs in thw middle. So the legs are the only thing connecting the halves together. In practice, there is I believe a metal backplate inside the screwholes in the couch, so at least the connection interface is all metal. Regardless, from a structural stability standpoint, it feels subpar., "When assembled, its noticeably…empty. The middle doesnt have enough cushioning before my 140lb body bottoms out on the frame, and the middles of each half only feels soft because there are hollow cavities where there used to be the arms and legs stored for transport. This might sound bad, but it actually has the opposite effect, turning into something like a (admittedly crappy) hammock."

QA_Content: The user has mentioned that the sofa-couch feels subpar from a structural stability standpoint.
Processed_QA_Content: I feel that the sofa-couch lacks structural stability.
accept1: I feel that the sofa-couch lacks structural stability.

Review text: This couch is such a great purchase! We’ve had issues with getting couches into our basement. The garage door is too narrow and the back door doesn’t open wide (it’s actually narrower than the garage door). The stairs are the best bet but we have ceiling impediments and the turning radius is tight. Modular furniture seemed to be the solution and I also just like the idea of being able to move the pieces around to accommodate what we need at any given moment. I’m very particular about sturdiness, specifically in couches. This couch is everything I wanted! It’s supportive without feeling too hard. It’s the perfect place to relax and splay out with the cats when watching movies, will accommodate my husbands needs of sleeping in the basement when he has restless leg issues (the coolness in the basement helps with his legs), and allows for a bigger seating area when we have friends over. Careful with the terry material - our cats claws are easily ripping it to shreds whereas I feel the weave might have survived better. Still, it’s an easy fix.

If they made the pillows a bit softer maybe that would help.

Review text: We adore the color, the relative ease of set up, and getting the boxes through the door and stairs, the layout options, the storage, and the fabric. Unfortunately, I cannot say that it is comfortable. The seats are too shallow, and the backrest too low. I have to use other pillows to prop myself up, and find myself wanting to sit elsewhere as it is so firm. It is a simple design flaw to fix though would require more materials and bump the cost up, so maybe that's why they skimped on those things. Also, there are not enough "side" pieces, so there is a gap against the wall and the pillows hang over. If they made the pillows a bit softer maybe that would help. Will see if it softens up over time. Otherwise, it is a gorgeous couch. Paid around $1400 for the 6 piece model, and we are glad we got all six pieces as they fit sill in our small-ish livingroom. Final note, the directions were not all that helpful as they suggested there was a hidden pocket inside the side pieces which we searched for but didn't find. Hope this is helpful.

Review text: The media could not be loaded.                , "'xa0For the price, you really cant beat it. I researched lovesac and some of the other popular sectionals, but with pets I wasnt willing to invest that much money. The big seller for me was being washable. The material is fine, but its obviously not super durable so well limit how often we wash them. We did buy covers for all the cushions for $125 as added protection.  If we get 5 years out of the sofa, Ill consider that a win. Comfort wise I am surprisingly pleased with. Its on the firmer side but I prefer that. The only complaints are the height and the arm rests. I knew the height was 17 when I purchased them, but the 2 inches lower than my other chairs is quite noticeable. I may end up getting higher legs. The armrests are the same as the backrest and the are adjustable to fit your needs. The problem is when you get up and pull on the armrest for assistance the mechanism that allows for the adjustments moves. I wish the company would have just made the armrests stationary. It would have been cheaper for them and I think most would prefer a solid armrest."

Review text: We've had this couch just over a month. Very comfortable, if you like a firm couch; just a lot smaller than expected. Our last couch was 131" wide and this is such a big difference! I do love that the cushions are washable and the extra storage is awesome too. We got this after having our first baby since we figured she can destroy it and we can buy a new one in a year or two. Hopefully this lasts that long. The only thing I wish I could change would be making the pillows on the ottomans stick somehow. I may put velcro on the cushions. They just slide around a lot. The back cushions are low but we have our couch up against a wall so it isn't that noticeable. I don't care for the reclining arm rests. The couch is very low to the ground so if you're any kind of tall, keep that in mind. My husband is 6' and he hates how low it is. It was very easy to put together. The boxes all came on the same day although I did have a delivery problem with FedEx. It said "signature required" but it was dropped off without signature. They also didn't stick to the delivery window they told us. They marked the packages as "undeliverable" before the time frame even started. I had to call FedEx and track my boxes which was a hassle. No smell, as some furniture can have. The boxes are fairly heavy, so you may need help. Color and style/shape look exactly as shown in the pictures. All in all, I do recommend this couch. I will update if I encounter any issues.

Review text: I got this sectional sofa for my fireplace room, and I appreciate the flexible design of this sofa because it gives me freedom to move the sofa around and create a completely different look to my fireplace room anytime., At first, I have assembled my sectional sofa into a cozy U shape sofa, and I invited my family over a couple of nights ago to have dinner with me and come try out my new sofa, we all enjoyed it so much and we were very comfortable sitting on this sofa., And I appreciate the fact that I can remove the covers from the back cushions to clean, as well as remove the covers from the sofa seat cushions because after everybody left, I noticed that my new sofa had some food crumbs right on top of my seat cushions so, I quickly open the zippers, removed the covers, closed the zippers right back and put the covers to wash., Even though the fabric of these sofa seat cushions seemed strong, I washed the covers in the wash machine using a clear and mild liquid laundry detergent, with cold water only, and on the delicate cycle because I did not want to take any chances and end up damaging neither the fabric nor the covers., After the sofa covers were washed, I let them air dry overnight, and I got up early in the morning the next day to check on my sofa covers. After I checked them carefully, I am glad to say that the covers did not have any food stains. Then, I placed the cushions right back inside of the covers., Because I thought that if I postpone placing the sofa cushions back inside of the covers, the cushions may not fit inside of the covers later. And there is one detail that I believe it is important for me to share, each cover has a zipper on one side only, so I had to squeeze the cushions a little bit to make them pass through the zipped area located on the side of each cover., Once the cushions got inside of the covers, I tapped the cushions around to make sure that the cushions would be well distributed and fit properly in the covers and I placed a few softener sheets inside of each cover and zipped the covers right back and not only my sofa cushions look brand new again but, my entire fireplace room got a suave aroma which made my sofa feel fresh, clean, and inviting., Additionally, this sofa has thick seat cushions that are not too firm nor too soft, the seat cushions are somewhere in the middle between soft and firm, but they do feel comfortable even if I am sitting on the sofa for a while., Furthermore, while the sofa armrests are more on the firm side, the back cushions are the opposite, the back cushions are padded and feel very soft and comfortable on my back, just the way I like., In addition to that, each seat has a built-in storage space, so I got some of the blankets that were taking up most of the space in my closet and I placed these blankets inside of a few seats and I still have storage space left in a couple of seats so, it is not bad at all., Yesterday I had a movie night in my house, so I decided to change my sectional sofa into a comfortable sofa bed, then, I put some fluffy pillows around, got some popcorn, placed a few snacks by the table, and I put some clean soft blankets over my sofa bed, to make the sofa extra soft and cozy so I could comfortably watch the movie and sleep in my sofa bed after the movie finished., Moreover, I like the fact that just by changing the shape of my sofa around, adding some fluffy throw pillows and soft blankets to my sectional sofa, my fireplace room looks clean, cozy, modern, and ended up with an entirely new look that I found very relaxing.

Review text: This is a great loveseat/couch for the price but I wish it had just one big seat cushion instead of two, or the two cushions would be firmer. I got this couch a couple of weeks ago, and it works great so far except that I keep sinking into the middle of the couch between the cushions. The cushions were firm to start with but I think they softened up since I have been using the couch every day, and now I keep adjusting and flipping the cushions to try use the different sides evenly. I ended up covering the cushions with a throw blanket that somewhat helps with this issue., The couch was really easy to assemble, it took me about 15 minutes to do it, and I only had to adjust one leg. If you ever assembled furniture from that big Swedish company, this assembly will be a piece of cake. Also, if you are fun-sized like me (aka below 5”4’), you can even squeeze yourself onto this couch for a nap.

Review text: Purchased this ‘sofa’ a few weeks past and was absolutely SHOCKED when it arrived- Two teeny-tiny,  very dinky boxes sitting on our front porch could not be the beautiful sofa from online that received so many wonderful 4+ star reviews (made us wonder who was doing the reviewing…) We unboxed and assembled, a fairly simple process of sliding/hooking pieces together (it comes in pieces- immediately a bad sign: arms, back, seat are all separate, legs must be screwed in). Note, a couple legs were scratched/damaged slightly even though the boxes were in tact. The sofa measures around 65-66” long, HOWEVER the actual seating width is much less (subtract arms). Someone said 3 adults could sit comfortably, someone was joking. Unless these adults stand less than 5’ there’s absolutely no way. The back of the sofa is short, hitting in a very uncomfortable spot. And speaking of uncomfortable, it’s 100% uncomfortable, no other way to describe it- hard, no support, teeny, miniature- It’s really a joke, we stood in amazement after assembling. From a distance the ‘sofa’ looks nice but I would NEVER, ever describe it as comfortable (even if I was being paid to do so). And such a HUGE  disappointment based on the 1000’s of extremely positive reviews. We started the return process but have yet to send it back, such a hassle to re-box and ship it. If you want the look of a small modern sofa (really only a loveseat, if even) that won’t be used except to fill space, this one’s for you. For comfort and longevity spend more and order from West Elm or Article or even World Market.

Processed_QA_Content: My sofa's actual seating width is much less than its overall length after subtracting the arms.
accept1: My sofa's actual seating width is much less than its overall length after subtracting the arms.

Review text: "This changes my view of what a sofa should be: this consists of basically 4 pieces (bottom base, backrest, and sides) The pieces lock together with slide-together brackets, which makes the assembly stupid-simple. In fact when I go to move it in the future, I wont be grunting it down the stairs - I will disassemble it.  I was fearful that this slide-together assembly would make it wobbly or squeaky, but this is NOT the case - It is rock solid. The slide-together brackets are very heavy gage metal.", The sofa is firm. If you want to be swallowed by a couch like one of those oversutffed jobs you see criminals sitting on in the TV show "Cops", you should move on., Fit and finish is great.  It has a low back which is in keeping with the mid-century motif so that's something to know. It measures 15" from seat cushion to the top of the backrest.  Also, 7" from the seat cushion to the top surface of the armrest., Would buy again.

The sofa is small, which is specified in the measurements, it was easy to put together and is sturdy, but for over $300, I expected better quality fabric. I have bought stuff in this price range before that was just fine. This one is is not worth what they are charging for it.

Review text: "Its as described. Small sofa yet gets the job done. Ive had this couch for over a year now and I use it daily along with my dogs. Having pets has made me blow through plenty of pricey furniture and I decided to go the affordable route this time around. The material is soft and its easy to clean/spot clean. I will say the sofa is firm and not thee most comfortable, but it def. hasnt sagged or sunk in on me in which others have. Also the material is great and has not snagged and I have cats and dogs on it every minute they can get. It serves its purpose of being a cozy little couch to sit on daily and watch TV and relax! If youre looking to not break your bank or get something for a smaller space, then this is your match! BTW the pic posted is taken after owning it for almost 2 years and using it daily. Assembly was super easy as well."

Review text: The microfiber sofa required assembly, and I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised by the overall quality and comfort. Despite the initial hassle of putting it together, the result was worth it. The microfiber material used for this sofa is incredibly soft and feels pleasing to the touch. However, it is prone to attracting lint and pet hair easily. I appreciate that it is easy to clean, as spills and stains are bound to happen in a household with pets., The design of the sofa is sleek and modern, fitting in nicely with my existing decor. It offers ample seating space, perfect for entertaining guests or simply lounging around. The cushions are firm yet comfortable, providing adequate support for extended periods of sitting. I was impressed with the sturdiness of the frame once fully assembled. The instructions were clear and easy to follow, making the assembly process relatively straightforward. While it did take some time and effort to put together, the result was a solid and well-built sofa that I am confident will last for years to come., Overall, despite the initial assembly, this microfiber sofa has exceeded my expectations regarding quality, comfort, and style. I would highly recommend it to anyone needing a functional and attractive seating option for their home.

Theres no way to slide the back piece in place because its about an inch away from the connection on one side. Cant do it by myself, so Ill have to wait for a friend to come help. Other than that, its a great couch.", "One other thing: the dark gray is really black, and the micro fabric is basically velvet. If this isnt what youre looking for, this isnt the couch for you. Its not what I imagined, but Im looking forward to it. It. It will serve my purposes for some years to come. All of this is manageable. Just manage your expectations before you buy it."

Despite the initial hassle of putting it together, the result was worth it. The microfiber material used for this sofa is incredibly soft and feels pleasing to the touch. However, it is prone to attracting lint and pet hair easily. I appreciate that it is easy to clean, as spills and stains are bound to happen in a household with pets., The design of the sofa is sleek and modern, fitting in nicely with my existing decor. It offers ample seating space, perfect for entertaining guests or simply lounging around. The cushions are firm yet comfortable, providing adequate support for extended periods of sitting. I was impressed with the sturdiness of the frame once fully assembled. The instructions were clear and easy to follow, making the assembly process relatively straightforward. While it did take some time and effort to put together, the result was a solid and well-built sofa that I am confident will last for years to come., Overall, despite the initial assembly, this microfiber sofa has exceeded my expectations regarding quality, comfort, and style. I would highly recommend it to anyone needing a functional and attractive seating option for their home.

Review text: Very comfortable sofa and bed. It is soft to the touch but just firm enough when you sit or lay flat as a mattress. The memory foam definitely adds the extra comfort, which in my opinion probably makes it more worthwhile at this higher price point., Our sofa took about 2 days for the cushion and fabric cover to completely expand. We knew this because the wrinkles all disappeared., The quality of the grey color looks very nice and works well next to our grey L shaped couch as well as in our kids’ rooms or our reading nook., We mainly use this for our kids when they’re reading or watching tv, and doubling it as a guest floor mattress when we need to., I expected to off gas this item in the garage as it’s made out of foam but there was no smell when we opened it and we able to let it expand inside the house., Yes, it does have a low back, however my husband and myself find that it provides enough comfort and support when we sit on it. You can also expand it like a bed but fold up the backing as an incline for your neck if you want to lounge all the way down., We own a nugget comfort cushion for our kids and the overall appearance looks like it could blend in with our play cushions.. as our kids jumped right on it when they saw it laid out. We sometimes use the nugget for our kids to sleep on the floor and this sleeps more comfortably., Overall, we love this sofa bed. It works perfectly for our space as we can squeeze the twin size into our reading nook, beside a crib, downstairs sprawled out in front of the couch, or next to our bed for a sleepover. We don’t plan on ever storing it away and we wouldn’t have much space for that as it doesn’t roll up. But because of its versatility it works in almost any room in our house.

Review text: The SUYOLS Folding Sofa Bed with Pillow is an excellent choice for anyone looking for a comfortable, versatile, and stylish piece of furniture for their living space. As a proud owner of this sofa bed, I can confidently say that it has exceeded my expectations regarding quality, comfort, and functionality., Firstly, the design of this sofa bed is both modern and elegant, with a light blue (navy blue in twin size) color that easily complements any decor. The material used is soft and durable, and the stitching is of high quality, ensuring that the sofa bed will last many years., "However, the most impressive feature of this sofa bed is its functionality. It easily converts from a comfortable chair to a floor couch and a sleeping mattress, making it perfect for small apartments, guest rooms, and home offices. The memory foam mattress provides ample support and comfort, ensuring you get a good nights sleep every time you use it. The pillow that comes with the sofa bed is also a nice touch, as it adds extra comfort for both sitting and sleeping.", I also appreciate how easy it is to fold and store this sofa bed. It can be easily folded and stored in a closet or under a bed, making it perfect for those who live in small spaces or have limited storage options. The lightweight design also makes it easy to move around and transport if needed., Another great feature of this sofa bed is its versatility. It can be used in various settings, including a living room, dorm room, guest room, home office, or upstairs loft. Whether you need extra sleeping space for guests or a comfortable place to sit and read a book, this sofa bed can easily accommodate your needs., Overall, I highly recommend the SUYOLS Folding Sofa Bed with Pillow to anyone looking for a high-quality, comfortable, and versatile piece of furniture. The stylish design, memory foam mattress, and easy-to-fold design make it a great investment for anyone looking to maximize their living space without sacrificing comfort or style., In terms of assembly, the sofa bed is relatively easy to put together, and it comes with clear instructions that make the process straightforward. All the necessary hardware is included, and one person can complete the assembly in under an hour., "In terms of comfort, the memory foam mattress is incredibly supportive and provides excellent comfort and pressure relief. It is perfect for people who suffer from back pain or who need a supportive surface for a good nights sleep. The pillow that comes with the sofa bed is also very comfortable and provides excellent neck support.", The sofa bed is also very easy to clean, and the cover can be removed and washed in a standard washing machine. The cover is also durable and resistant to wear and tear, ensuring that the sofa bed looks great for years to come., Finally, the price point of this sofa bed is excellent, especially considering the high-quality materials and construction. Compared to other similar sofa beds on the market, the SUYOLS Folding Sofa Bed with Pillow offers excellent value for money, making it an affordable and practical investment for anyone looking for a comfortable and versatile piece of furniture., "In conclusion, if youre looking for a comfortable, stylish, and versatile piece of furniture for your home, then the SUYOLS Folding Sofa Bed with Pillow is an excellent choice. With its modern design, memory foam mattress, and easy-to-fold design, this sofa bed provides excellent value for money and is perfect for anyone who needs extra sleeping space or a comfortable seating area in their home. Highly recommended!"

Review text:
So I bought this for our guest room as an extra bed.

For starters, it’s way more gray than the pictures.

There’s no”brown” aspect aside from the wooden legs.

It’s rock hard- no cushioning at all.

It’s also super short.

I’m 5’5 and I can’t even lay down.

The only thing this is good for is maybe a toddler?

But it’s so narrow that I doubt even a small child would be able to sleep on it.

I’ll keep it because I don’t want the hassle of returning it

but I definitely do NOT recommend.

Review text: **the black line on the wall is for reference of how much shorter this couch is than my previous. If you dont want to do it yourself then go pay more and buy one already assembled in the store, right?

It was worth every pains taking hour that it took me to assemble it.

In all honesty by myself it took about two and a half hours to assemble.

The majority of that time was putting on all the legs.

It is very sturdy very well built extremely high quality fabric.

It has a designer look about it.

The back cushions are removable making the sofa wide enough to sleep on.

I highly recommend!

Review text: I’m sharing photos of the back of the couch since the listing doesn’t include any, and per the seller this is just what the back looks like. Review text: I had this sofa on my wish list for quite awhile and finally purchased it on sale. I purchased it for my home office and I relax on it all the time. The fold up sides have three optional positions and when it lays flat it has more overall sitting area. The back of the couch can be upright, reclined or laid flat. The reclining position feels as if it reclines a little too much so I always keep it upright. It is easy to assemble. I would recommend that you put something under the feet though as it will slide easily on bare floors.,  It felt stiff at first but now it is really comfortable. In addition...because there is a support board behind it when it is not lying flat I store some things behind it which puts them out of sight.

Review text: I had this sofa on my wish list for quite awhile and finally purchased it on sale. I purchased it for my home office and I relax on it all the time. The fold up sides have three optional positions and when it lays flat it has more overall sitting area. The back of the couch can be upright, reclined or laid flat. The reclining position feels as if it reclines a little too much so I always keep it upright. It is easy to assemble. I would recommend that you put something under the feet though as it will slide easily on bare floors.,  It felt stiff at first but now it is really comfortable. In addition...because there is a support board behind it when it is not lying flat I store some things behind it which puts them out of sight.

Review text: Easy to put together (assemble). Light weight. Functions properly and easily. Holds weight well. Charging ports light up, so easy to see at night and they work without issues. Measurements are correct. With that said, when you lay horizontally on it in couch setting, you can't be taller than 5'3" if you don't want to curl your legs up or lay sideways then it's perfect to stretch out on. When in bed mode, you must lay at an angle with your head not blocked by the end pieces as well as your feet. It is VERY hard, which is fine for my family because it's great on our backs (we have back, neck, and ACL injuries). Small accent pillows will fit without taking up too much room. In couch mode or bed mode, a regular sized pillow fits nicely too., My only complaint is it sits very low to the floor, so it isn't made for people I'd estimate 5'9" and over to sit down without your knees up to chest height.

Review text: This couch is extremely small. I am 6 foot tall and can barely even lay down all way. Definitely can’t cuddle with my girlfriend whatsoever. The back of the couch goes halfway up my back so sitting up right is uncomfortable as well. No sitting or laying position is comfortable with this couch. It says it is black velvet but it is not. It is low quality microfiber. The arms of the couch fall off constantly as there is no Velcro strips. You can’t even take the back cushions off because there is a piece of wood in the way. This couch is very low quality and very small and is worth about 200 dollars. I tried to give it a chance but I wish I would’ve just returned it.

Review text: Overall 2 1/2 stars, Not worth this price, At BEST should be $300 for this, It’s very low to the ground, small at best it is fitting 4 seating comfortably. Pillows instead of arm rest is a joke- not at all at arms length and won’t be used these arm pillows take up unnecessary space from seating. The brackets used to hold the couch sections in place didn’t have aligned access holes drilled from manufacturers evenly so I can’t attach the sections to each other properly. Poor design. Couch came in 3 boxes. Couch pillows and covers are double bubble wrapped and are not very thick. Directions say pillows will fluff up over night I am not convinced., Took me and my 9 yo about half an hour to assemble., October- one month after purchase update-, The pillows never got any fluffier than they did when I took them out of the package. The couch does not stay together due to the bracket holes being sloppy drilled. Bracket holes were never drilled in properly from the manufacture so the couch sections absolutely do not align with each other and if you have a group sit down, it is awkward as the pieces shift, the couch itself is not comfortable. The padding is extremely thin, absolutely hurts your hips and thighs if you plan on actually enjoying -definitely not a couch you can sleep on extremely uncomfortable. The cushions and couch pillows every single use have to be adjusted the padding for the seating portion must go underneath the pillow. Every time you sit down the cushion itself will move out of place you’re back will not be comfortable your butt will not be comfortable. Actually none of this is comfortable. I have had to add additional pillows, including regular pillows behind the back just so it’s bearable. Honestly, wish I could return this item and get a full refund. If you read the fine print, it actually says you can’t return this item unless it’s in its original packaging. There is absolutely no way after opening up the three boxes. It came in getting out all of the material that it even would fit right back in there because they double vacuum seal, everything meaning that there’s no physical way for you to put it back into the box for a return the manufacture is absolutely doing this on purpose. I give this couch a 1 1/2 star rating Certainly not worth the money. This couch needs to absolutely be no more than $300. Poor design not comfortable not large, NOT COMFORTABLE, December update: the most uncomfortable couch I have ever bought literally you get pain you can’t even sit for a 90 minute movie without your lower back hips actually hurting! I don’t know what kind of cheap cushioning they put in this couch, but you can literally feel everything underneath you like the hard service underneath. The couch moves around every time you sit down, the back rest, never stays in place the cushions behind you are a joke and have absolutely no support. This couch is honestly a piece of trash. DO NOT DO IT

Review text: Overall 2 1/2 stars, Not worth this price, At BEST should be $300 for this, It’s very low to the ground, small at best it is fitting 4 seating comfortably. Pillows instead of arm rest is a joke- not at all at arms length and won’t be used these arm pillows take up unnecessary space from seating. The brackets used to hold the couch sections in place didn’t have aligned access holes drilled from manufacturers evenly so I can’t attach the sections to each other properly. Poor design. Couch came in 3 boxes. Couch pillows and covers are double bubble wrapped and are not very thick. Directions say pillows will fluff up over night I am not convinced., Took me and my 9 yo about half an hour to assemble., October- one month after purchase update-, The pillows never got any fluffier than they did when I took them out of the package. The couch does not stay together due to the bracket holes being sloppy drilled. Bracket holes were never drilled in properly from the manufacture so the couch sections absolutely do not align with each other and if you have a group sit down, it is awkward as the pieces shift, the couch itself is not comfortable. The padding is extremely thin, absolutely hurts your hips and thighs if you plan on actually enjoying -definitely not a couch you can sleep on extremely uncomfortable. The cushions and couch pillows every single use have to be adjusted the padding for the seating portion must go underneath the pillow. Every time you sit down the cushion itself will move out of place you’re back will not be comfortable your butt will not be comfortable. Actually none of this is comfortable. I have had to add additional pillows, including regular pillows behind the back just so it’s bearable. Honestly, wish I could return this item and get a full refund. If you read the fine print, it actually says you can’t return this item unless it’s in its original packaging. There is absolutely no way after opening up the three boxes. It came in getting out all of the material that it even would fit right back in there because they double vacuum seal, everything meaning that there’s no physical way for you to put it back into the box for a return the manufacture is absolutely doing this on purpose. I give this couch a 1 1/2 star rating Certainly not worth the money. This couch needs to absolutely be no more than $300. Poor design not comfortable not large, NOT COMFORTABLE, December update: the most uncomfortable couch I have ever bought literally you get pain you can’t even sit for a 90 minute movie without your lower back hips actually hurting! I don’t know what kind of cheap cushioning they put in this couch, but you can literally feel everything underneath you like the hard service underneath. The couch moves around every time you sit down, the back rest, never stays in place the cushions behind you are a joke and have absolutely no support. This couch is honestly a piece of trash. DO NOT DO IT

Review text: "After a decade with an Ikea couch, I realized it was time to put the old girl out to pasture. Knowing I was looking for a 60s-70s-leaning, just-after-midcentury sectional in muted earthtones or something of the like—and more importantly, priced for those on a budget—I decided to take the chance on this sofa. And for the first time buying a couch without trying it out in person, Im actually really happy with the results.", "First things first: It arrives in one box. One 160-ish-pound box. That was an enthralling schlep, bringing it up three flights of stairs end over end. Thankfully, if you live in a walk-up, that initial lift will be the worst part of the whole experience—youll find a box full of organized components labeled by letter, accompanied by instructions that require little-to-no text.", "In short, assembly was kind of a breeze, though one caveat: the sofa legs included in my box had pre-drilled *slots* rather than circular holes, so the included bolts dont feel as secure as they should be. Im guessing they may be legs used for different furniture, some of which include different hardware for attachment. But barring that one (likely packing/assembly) hiccup, I had a couch assembled in roughly a half hour.", "Quality-wise? Not bad, especially for the price! I mentioned the legs and their seeming ill-suited, if minor-in-scale, attaching hardware—the only other potential weak point in the furniture seems to be the single bolt-and-wingnut point connecting the two sections of said sectional. At one point, I was assembling the couch upside down, and had to flip it over as one piece to continue—that single bolt/wingnut holding the two sections together felt inadequate as the pieces of the couch began to wiggle against one another. But, once righted, the couch assembly concluded and any concerns over sturdiness quickly subsided. Its a solid couch, and a comfortable one, to boot.", "Appearance-wise, it matches the photos, even if the legs are painted an utterly garish yellow gold. (Just throwing this out there, but a couch from this era would look better with simple tapered wood legs—maybe maple finish for some upholstery colors, walnut finish for others, just saying.) Along with the appearance, it truly is a comfy sit—initially a touch firm, but I imagine thatll ease with use.", "So, barring, what? A concerningly weak bolt/wingnut connecting sections—a nonexistent problem unless your feng shui is indecisive and the couch gets moved around on the daily—and possibly errant specs on the legs? The experience with this couch so far, from assembly to first impressions in aesthetics and strength alike, has been a great one. Beyond my wish for wood legs, itd be great to be able to buy backup upholstery fabric covers for the parts wherein its easy to remove/wash those covers, but theyre just a few wants: this couch has addressed all my needs for a comfy living space."

QA_Content: The user mentioned that the quality of the sofa is good, especially considering the price.
Processed_QA_Content: The sofa has good quality, especially considering its price.
accept1: The sofa has good quality, especially considering its price.

Review text:
I love it!!!

It’s very sturdy.

I took one of the best naps on it last night.

For my small apartment, I feel like it’s a good size and can accommodate 3 people (or more if all are sitting up).

I built it alone which means it’s very easy to assemble.

I think the most difficult thing to carry was the box, but once I got all the pieces out, the pieces were manageable.

I have a lot of light in my living room, and it showcases the beauty of this couch wonderfully.

I highly recommend!!

1000/10
