Review text: "After a decade with an Ikea couch, I realized it was time to put the old girl out to pasture. Knowing I was looking for a 60s-70s-leaning, just-after-midcentury sectional in muted earthtones or something of the like—and more importantly, priced for those on a budget—I decided to take the chance on this sofa. And for the first time buying a couch without trying it out in person, Im actually really happy with the results.", "First things first: It arrives in one box. One 160-ish-pound box. That was an enthralling schlep, bringing it up three flights of stairs end over end. Thankfully, if you live in a walk-up, that initial lift will be the worst part of the whole experience—youll find a box full of organized components labeled by letter, accompanied by instructions that require little-to-no text.", "In short, assembly was kind of a breeze, though one caveat: the sofa legs included in my box had pre-drilled *slots* rather than circular holes, so the included bolts dont feel as secure as they should be. Im guessing they may be legs used for different furniture, some of which include different hardware for attachment. But barring that one (likely packing/assembly) hiccup, I had a couch assembled in roughly a half hour.", "Quality-wise? Not bad, especially for the price! I mentioned the legs and their seeming ill-suited, if minor-in-scale, attaching hardware—the only other potential weak point in the furniture seems to be the single bolt-and-wingnut point connecting the two sections of said sectional. At one point, I was assembling the couch upside down, and had to flip it over as one piece to continue—that single bolt/wingnut holding the two sections together felt inadequate as the pieces of the couch began to wiggle against one another. But, once righted, the couch assembly concluded and any concerns over sturdiness quickly subsided. Its a solid couch, and a comfortable one, to boot.", "Appearance-wise, it matches the photos, even if the legs are painted an utterly garish yellow gold. (Just throwing this out there, but a couch from this era would look better with simple tapered wood legs—maybe maple finish for some upholstery colors, walnut finish for others, just saying.) Along with the appearance, it truly is a comfy sit—initially a touch firm, but I imagine thatll ease with use.", "So, barring, what? A concerningly weak bolt/wingnut connecting sections—a nonexistent problem unless your feng shui is indecisive and the couch gets moved around on the daily—and possibly errant specs on the legs? The experience with this couch so far, from assembly to first impressions in aesthetics and strength alike, has been a great one. Beyond my wish for wood legs, itd be great to be able to buy backup upholstery fabric covers for the parts wherein its easy to remove/wash those covers, but theyre just a few wants: this couch has addressed all my needs for a comfy living space."

Review text:
The couch is great and looks exactly as advertised.

Wonderful color and texture, definitely elevates my small apartment.

Love the reversible Chaise, that came in handy.

One downside is the bottom cushions are a bit too firm for sinking into or lounging ...

Review text: "I absolutely love this sofa. Its the perfect size. Most sofas available on Amazon are over 50 inches wide. Which is great but Im putting this in my office and have very limited space. It sits between my closet door (I barely go in) and the rooms door which opens all the way.", As you can see in the pic, it can seat two( I can sit next to my shollie mix just fine). But being by myself, I love the extra space for added comfort. And I barely leave my office now lol, "I love all of its features. The ottoman portion is easy to pull out, pull up, and set. And even easier to put away. The wheels are fine on my low pile carpet office. You can actually remove the ottoman portion (foot rest) easily. This is how I was able to bring it up to my second floor with no issue. It reclines in 3 places. 90 degrees, about 130 degrees, and flat. Perfect since Ill place a tv to the right of it but it will be on a mount that will extend 40 inches in front of the sofa. And the most unexpected part about this sofa is the snack tray hidden in the arm rest. You simply lift up the arm and pull out the tray. I also decided to put a USB hub in there so I can charge my devices as I use them while sitting.", "Its very comfortable in my opinion. Most futons are very hard because you can feel the base. But the cushion on this sofa is very comfy. The velvet cover is also soft and handles dog hair with ease. The color is as pictured. And looks great. Pillows are decent. I fell asleep on this soundly with no back issues or anything. Since some still manage to find similar sofas like this uncomfortable, Ill just say if you need a pillow top soft mattress, maybe add a mattress cover when you sleep. But I personally think its not needed. Especially when just lounging.", "Lastly, I saw that I have been using the reclining features wrong. The seller reached out to me to let me know just how to use them. To lay flat, pull forward til click then let go slowly. To lift to middle position, lift til first click and then let go. (If it clicks more than once, it wont hold. Start again). To get back to first position (90 degree) from second position, lift til 1 click. To go from flat to 90 degrees, 2 clicks then let go. It may be confusing on first read but when you get one, youll understand. I hope it helps."

Review text: "I absolutely love this sofa. Its the perfect size. Most sofas available on Amazon are over 50 inches wide. Which is great but Im putting this in my office and have very limited space. It sits between my closet door (I barely go in) and the rooms door which opens all the way.", As you can see in the pic, it can seat two( I can sit next to my shollie mix just fine). But being by myself, I love the extra space for added comfort. And I barely leave my office now lol, "I love all of its features. The ottoman portion is easy to pull out, pull up, and set. And even easier to put away. The wheels are fine on my low pile carpet office. You can actually remove the ottoman portion (foot rest) easily. This is how I was able to bring it up to my second floor with no issue. It reclines in 3 places. 90 degrees, about 130 degrees, and flat. Perfect since Ill place a tv to the right of it but it will be on a mount that will extend 40 inches in front of the sofa. And the most unexpected part about this sofa is the snack tray hidden in the arm rest. You simply lift up the arm and pull out the tray. I also decided to put a USB hub in there so I can charge my devices as I use them while sitting.", "Its very comfortable in my opinion. Most futons are very hard because you can feel the base. But the cushion on this sofa is very comfy. The velvet cover is also soft and handles dog hair with ease. The color is as pictured. And looks great. Pillows are decent. I fell asleep on this soundly with no back issues or anything. Since some still manage to find similar sofas like this uncomfortable, Ill just say if you need a pillow top soft mattress, maybe add a mattress cover when you sleep. But I personally think its not needed. Especially when just lounging.", "Lastly, I saw that I have been using the reclining features wrong. The seller reached out to me to let me know just how to use them. To lay flat, pull forward til click then let go slowly. To lift to middle position, lift til first click and then let go. (If it clicks more than once, it wont hold. Start again). To get back to first position (90 degree) from second position, lift til 1 click. To go from flat to 90 degrees, 2 clicks then let go. It may be confusing on first read but when you get one, youll understand. I hope it helps."

According to the Oxford Languages definition  an ottoman is "a low upholstered seat, or footstool, without a back or arms that typically serves also as a box, with the seat hinged to form a lid." Very deceiving., "Really what it all comes down to is if youre not trying to spend a fortune on a couch then get one second hand. Buying Chinese imports always seems to screw you in the end. Review text:
The pro is that it’s cheap and looks okay.

The con is that while it claims to be a sleeper, it’s too short to lay completely down in if you’re over 5’10”.

I’m 6’0” and I’m several inches too long.

Then there’s the issue of the 2 engineered wood legs that serve as the only link between the two halves of the couch: those will fail based on how much they flex when couch is moved.

I screwed on a 2x4 brace just so that I didn’t cringe whenever I scooted the couch.

The cushions are not soft, though, so dont expect a super soft/plush couch.", "Other things worth knowing. Supplier ships the couch in two boxes on different days. Review text: "I waited 8 months before writing this review, and can fully attest that I love this couch. It is perfect for small spaces and worth every penny. Originally, I had purchased it to live in my very tiny attic apartment to use as a couch/temporary bed. There were cheaper options, but I wanted to invest in something that I wanted to keep (aka was comfortable and wasnt an eye sore). It has turned out to be the most practical piece of furniture I own. I am a graphic designer/artist and it is clean looking, but a little retro. The deep teal is lovely: the fabric is not expensive and kinda thin, but it has held up to me sleeping on it for 4 months, moving, and sitting on it, and it is in good shape and looks great. Idk how it will handle small children, pets, or something equally destructive: Im not convinced it would survive that much wear and tear.", It is light(ish) and easy to assemble. I'm a 5'4", 180 lb woman, so short and strong, but I was able to get it into the back of a small SUV, up 3 flights of steep, winding stairs, and assemble it by myself in under an hour. Having a second person would have made it easier, but it wasn't necessary., "Reading the reviews, I was a bit nervous that it wouldnt be comfortable enough to sleep on for an extended period of time, but I slept on it for 4 months. It isnt plush: its firm and not overly squishy. I tend to like firmer mattresses (I prefer a cot to an air mattress), so I vastly prefer this to sofas that you sink into. Another customer mentioned that the cushions on the bottom are hollow because the arms of the sofa are packed into these spaces so that it ships smaller. You can feel this when you sit down and its kinda weird at first BUT it ends up being what makes it comfy. This was the part that eventually got to me after sleeping on my side everyday for months: I put a blanket down for a little extra cushion, but as a side sleeper, itll get to your hips. Its definitely great for short term: perfect for a single person crashing overnight (its now for my drunk friends).", "Something that has also come in handy: the backs are adjustable. Not only does it lay flat or sit up, you can also prop it up at a 45 degree angle, which comes in handy for sport injuries or overall laziness. Id like to reiterate that Im short and my friends/family are short, so this has been a great little couch. Idk if youd love it if youre super tall or have a big space, but its perfect for my little city apartment and I highly recommend it."

Review text:
You really need two people to unbox and assemble this, but it's worth the effort.  

Made in Thailand, not China, it is not complicated to put together.

My wife bought a set of twin sheets and slept on it last night.

She was pleased with it.

If you're over 5'7", you might leave off the bolts holding one arm rest.

It slides up and down on metal tracks and is quite sturdy.

Take off an arm when you need to for a taller person.

Review text: "So the couch is fine. It looks like the photo, its very firm, and time will tell how it holds up. Its worth knowing in advance that the couch is made up if two halves that are only held together by the four screws holding on the middle legs. The middle legs appear to be made out of plastic, so I am concerned about how well that is going to hold up. The velvet fabric is nice and soft, though, and the color is accurate (got the gold one). The cushions are not soft, though, so dont expect a super soft/plush couch.", "Other things worth knowing. Supplier ships the couch in two boxes on different days. I got one on Wednesday and one on Friday, despite both the tracking and the vendor telling me directly that it would arrive Thursday. I have no idea why they choose to ship on different days, it makes no sense and is wildly inconvenient. The first package had no instructions with it, so I wasnt even aware that some of the pieces were zipped into the bottom of the piece I received until the second box arrived.", "Also, this couch is sold by a 3rd party vendor, so Amazon will not be helpful at all in dealing with them, should a situation arise where, for instance, youre trying to find out why only half a couch was delivered.", "Long story short. The couch is fine so far. I will probably add some supports to make sure it doesnt snap in the middle because its held together by two small pieces of plastic, but barring any major disasters, it looks and seems like I expected."

Review text: "I waited 8 months before writing this review, and can fully attest that I love this couch. It is perfect for small spaces and worth every penny. Originally, I had purchased it to live in my very tiny attic apartment to use as a couch/temporary bed. There were cheaper options, but I wanted to invest in something that I wanted to keep (aka was comfortable and wasnt an eye sore). It has turned out to be the most practical piece of furniture I own. I am a graphic designer/artist and it is clean looking, but a little retro. The deep teal is lovely: the fabric is not expensive and kinda thin, but it has held up to me sleeping on it for 4 months, moving, and sitting on it, and it is in good shape and looks great. Idk how it will handle small children, pets, or something equally destructive: Im not convinced it would survive that much wear and tear.", It is light(ish) and easy to assemble. I'm a 5'4", 180 lb woman, so short and strong, but I was able to get it into the back of a small SUV, up 3 flights of steep, winding stairs, and assemble it by myself in under an hour. Having a second person would have made it easier, but it wasn't necessary., "Reading the reviews, I was a bit nervous that it wouldnt be comfortable enough to sleep on for an extended period of time, but I slept on it for 4 months. It isnt plush: its firm and not overly squishy. I tend to like firmer mattresses (I prefer a cot to an air mattress), so I vastly prefer this to sofas that you sink into. Another customer mentioned that the cushions on the bottom are hollow because the arms of the sofa are packed into these spaces so that it ships smaller. You can feel this when you sit down and its kinda weird at first BUT it ends up being what makes it comfy. This was the part that eventually got to me after sleeping on my side everyday for months: I put a blanket down for a little extra cushion, but as a side sleeper, itll get to your hips. Its definitely great for short term: perfect for a single person crashing overnight (its now for my drunk friends).", "Something that has also come in handy: the backs are adjustable. Not only does it lay flat or sit up, you can also prop it up at a 45 degree angle, which comes in handy for sport injuries or overall laziness. Id like to reiterate that Im short and my friends/family are short, so this has been a great little couch. Idk if youd love it if youre super tall or have a big space, but its perfect for my little city apartment and I highly recommend it."

It’s okay as it will be kept in a small room folded up.  

The frame is very sturdy, and even though it is a tad smaller than a twin, it’s wide enough to rollover when sleeping.

I am going to add a foam topper for future use.

It's a bit firm but still very comfortable.

Altogether, I'm thrilled with the purchase.

Review text: CONS: This is the most UNCOMFORTABLE sofa I’ve ever sat on let alone purchased! THERE IS NOTHING MEMORY FOAM ABOUT THIS SOFA. The cushion is very rigid almost like it’s fighting back. It’s extremely uncomfortable. I’ve had it for a year now and I’m still in pain after watching a movie so forget ever falling asleep on this thing or thinking guests will want to sleep on it in “bed mode”.  The seat cushions are aweful! Not much more comfortable than a carpeted floor. When you sit on it you can feel and hear the strings and your ass goes numb after 30 minutes., I don’t trust these backs., PROS: RECONFIGURATION is wonderful. As someone who likes to change up the feng shui I really appreciate the extreme flexibility that this sectional offers. Turn it into a bed, cinema chairs, sectional, sofa and arm chair etc. I originally found this sofa after falling in love with the LoveSac sofa. But I wasn’t ready to pay that price (smh I should’ve just taking the plunge for comfort), ENDLESS STORAGE is amazing especially in an apartment needing extra space. This is great esp when some only have singular ottoman storage. Blankets, sheets, pillows etc right at your finger tips but out of sight. I do wish that the lids had a hinge. A 90 DEGREE HINGE WOULD REALLY HELP to avoid pulling all cushions off the sofa to get to those stored items., WASHABLE: I have a 4 year old and a cat…. Need I say more? I am grateful for a sofa that can accommodate my lifestyle so I don’t stress or worry about her crafts eating etc. However the cat has claimed one of the armrests as his own personal scratching post despite the 3 scratching items he has around the house. But looking at the bright side with this sofa I can replace it…, Obviously there are a number of things that I love about this sofa but the discomfort alone makes me want to sell it and invest in the LoveSac.

Review text: This sofa is one of my favorite pieces in my apartment currently. It’s the perfect size for my small apartment, and the storage is a plus; all pillows fit perfectly when made into a bed., I assembled this sofa all on my own (please note it’s advised to have 2 people assembling). It took me a whole day but was not hard to do (also note there are no words with the instructions, making it a bit challenging). It comes in 2 boxes; mine arrived a day apart. When assembling, I thought I was missing parts but soon realized the ‘missing’ parts were in a box labeled ‘missing parts’ lol., As for the L-shape, I wanted it to go on the right side instead of the left, as it’s supposed to be. I figured out a way to do so. On the side of the sofa where the arms are supposed to go, there are ‘hooks’ where you would normally place the arms. I decided to swap them in order to be able to change where the L-shape went., Regarding the comfortableness of the sofa, it’s very soft with fluffy pillows. If you plan to use it as a bed for guests or personal use, I would recommend getting a mattress pad to add a bit more comfort, as the divide of the cushions is a bit uncomfortable. The pull-out part is very easy (note that the only thing holding this part are 2 screws from coming out)., It looks beautiful, though, and I would recommend it!”

Review text: This sofa is one of my favorite pieces in my apartment currently. It’s the perfect size for my small apartment, and the storage is a plus; all pillows fit perfectly when made into a bed., I assembled this sofa all on my own (please note it’s advised to have 2 people assembling). It took me a whole day but was not hard to do (also note there are no words with the instructions, making it a bit challenging). It comes in 2 boxes; mine arrived a day apart. When assembling, I thought I was missing parts but soon realized the ‘missing’ parts were in a box labeled ‘missing parts’ lol., As for the L-shape, I wanted it to go on the right side instead of the left, as it’s supposed to be. I figured out a way to do so. On the side of the sofa where the arms are supposed to go, there are ‘hooks’ where you would normally place the arms. I decided to swap them in order to be able to change where the L-shape went., Regarding the comfortableness of the sofa, it’s very soft with fluffy pillows. If you plan to use it as a bed for guests or personal use, I would recommend getting a mattress pad to add a bit more comfort, as the divide of the cushions is a bit uncomfortable. The pull-out part is very easy (note that the only thing holding this part are 2 screws from coming out)., It looks beautiful, though, and I would recommend it!”

Review text: I love the storage, love the pull out bed,  and it’s cool that my giant dogs can fit on it with me… but here are my complaints:, 1. The chaise lounges are super short. I’m 5’7 and my legs hang off the end., 2. There are no arm rests to speak off. I added a ton of filler, an entire bag worth, they still aren’t full., 3. The backrest cushions are super flat. I added queen sized pillows to all 4 cushions and they now look right., 4. The backrest to this couch is extremely low. It hits me below my scapula. Like mid back. Again,  I am only 5’7. It’s such a bummer., Overall, would not recommend.

Review text: "I recently ordered this convertible folding sofa due to an unexpected news of a move by the end of January.  Our new living room is is smaller, and our oversized, old sectional wont fit. This portable sleeper sofa is a perfect temporary solution, and we plan to use in in our spare bedroom later.  This sofa is of excellent quality, made of high-density foam, and soft breathable fabric.  The removable covers and smooth, durable zippers make maintenance very easy.  The adjustable backrest adds comfort and support for your back, and included pillows add a touch of versatility, while the ease of conversion to a queen-size mattress is a game-changer.  No assembly is required - just pull it out and enjoy.  Though we havent fully used it yet, a test run left us very impressed.  Its a stylish and elegant addition to our new home, reasonably priced for its quality, comfort, and versatility.  Highly recommended for anyone in need of a flexible and comfortable sofa!"

Review text: "Its a foam fold out chair/bed.  Its not uncomfortable, but not really firm or supportive either.  Aside from the foam, theres no structure to it.  Probably best for average size or smaller folks, especially kids.  It did have a vaguely chemically smell upon opening, but it dissipated as it filled up and had time to sit.  It does sit somewhat low to the ground compared to the average sofa or chair, but it does beat sitting or sleeping on the floor.  Right now, my pets have commandeered it and Im content with that, but its nice to have on hand in case weve a surprise visitor that would require extra seating or someplace to nap or sleep on.  Im not totally disappointed with it, but do wish it was firm/more supportive and perhaps thicker or perhaps had one more segment of cushion so that when folded up into chair form it sat a bit higher."
